N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 899.21 - Accounts

State Regulations
(a) All work papers
used in calculating account balances and transaction totals shall be
permanently maintained as part of the general ledger. (b) If account balances and transaction
totals are not posted directly to the accounts but are posted from entries or
totals contained in another system of accounts, such books, including general
and subsidiary ledgers and supporting books and records shall be preserved as
long as the books of account prescribed by the URS are preserved. (c) All reports shall reflect the accrual
basis of accounting. Generally accepted accounting principles shall be used in
establishing the accounting treatment of any financial transaction, except that
the commission may require such accounting treatment as will yield information
necessary to a proper discharge of the commission' s
responsibilities. Notes
